definition: to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: May I have the honor of this dance?
sentences.chinese: 可以賞光和我跳個舞嗎？

sentences.english: We wonder whether you would be willing to attend our end-of-the-year party.
sentences.chinese: 不知道您能否賞光，參加我們的年終聯歡會。

sentences.english: They did me the honor of attending my exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 他們賞光出席我的展覽會。

sentences.english: May we have you as our guest of honor?
sentences.chinese: 您能否賞光，作爲我們的嘉賓？

sentences.english: Thank you, Eric. It's good of you to come.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝，埃裏克，你能賞光真好。

sentences.english: Prof.wang,would you do us favor by coming to our English evening this Saturday?
sentences.chinese: 王教授，請您賞光來參加我們星期六的英語晚會好嗎？

sentences.english: I was wondering if you'd like to dance?
sentences.chinese: 我在想你是否願意賞光陪我跳支舞？

sentences.english: Professor Wang, please your honor to take part in our Saturday evening in English, please?
sentences.chinese: 王教授，請您賞光來參加我們星期六的英語晚會好嗎？

sentences.english: Would you honor us with a visit?
May I have the pleasure of engaging you for the dance?
sentences.chinese: 能賞光同我跳波羅耐斯舞嗎？
